DOC.brief_summary: It's the aim of this study to clarify, whether the non-invasive assessment of breath can serve as a novel clinical tool to assist in the diagnosis of CLAD. If different stages of BOS can be discriminated by the level of certain VOCs than there would also be a potential to actually predict the development at an early stage and would enable an earlier intervention.
DOC.brief_title: Breath Volatile Organic Compounds Patterns of Lung Transplant Patients With Chronic Lung Allograft Dysfunction
DOC.criteria: Outpatient bilateral lung transplant recipients including combined transplants Active Smoking Oxygen therapy Infection with multi or panresistant bacteria
